TopicTitle: DOES ANYONE HAVE A KSP SOUNDTRACK, IF SO, WHATS IN IT?

Articles.Content:
So I find that the background music for KSP isn't the most exciting stuff in the world.  I'm making a playlist for while I'm playing.  Does anyone have a similar playlist, and if so, what all is on it?

 

ALSO, COME SUPPORT OUT ME KERBAL CHANNEL!!!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCkrhECdyyuDUReHIGkchbUQ

IS THERE ANY WAY YOU COULD TURN OFF CAPS LOCK?

Oh, and Some nice chill music does justice for a spacecraft drifting through the cosmos. 

Edited January 28, 2019 by Lo Var Lachland

Here's the bulk of it. From the source himself.

https://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/most/kerbalspaceprogram.php

4 minutes ago, 5thHorseman said:

Here's the bulk of it. From the source himself.

https://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/most/kerbalspaceprogram.php

He's got a whole bunch of royalty free music you can use in videos and such.  Very cool site and it's amazing the amount of stuff he puts out.

The music that I listen to while playing KSP isn't really correlated to the game, rather, it's just stuff I enjoy (mostly 70s-80s punk and 90s rock). I suggest just listening to whatever makes you happy while you play!

27 minutes ago, SpecialSpock said:

The music that I listen to while playing KSP isn't really correlated to the game, rather, it's just stuff I enjoy (mostly 70s-80s punk and 90s rock). I suggest just listening to whatever makes you happy while you play!

Exactly. I just isten to anything that I like.

A crapload of Kirby music? Check.

The most microscopic amount of EDM/Dubstep? Check.

The occasional song on the radio? As a last resort.

I do not yet have a playlist; recently I have been mostly listening to Spotify's daily mixes (along with favouriting songs which are recommended to me, to encourage the app to give me similar styles) in an effort to diversify my music taste. A rather entertaining result from this, however, was that around a week ago I was doing this while playing KSP and a song (which I had never previously heard of) called "Head Of NASA" started playing.
I'm usually listening to orchestral music while playing, and that usually means classical or film soundtracks. Mahler, Hovhaness, John Adams, Horner, Goldsmith, Williams, etc...
I listen to whatever I feel like listening, though it usually ranges between folk, country, folk rock, soft rock, baroque, classical (as in the period between baroque and romantic), and romantic.

5 hours ago, 5thHorseman said:

Here's the bulk of it. From the source himself.

https://incompetech.com/music/royalty-free/most/kerbalspaceprogram.php

Interesting... "Bathed in the Light" isn't in there...

So I find that the background music for KSP isn't the most exciting stuff in the world.  I'm making a playlist for while I'm playing.  Does anyone have a similar playlist, and if so, what all is on it?

Ever heard of Ehrling?

I just use assorted albums from jimi hendrix. I don't have a playlist because I am just too lazy to make one.

Edited January 28, 2019 by lapis

In a bit of take my [redacted for language, ed.] money idea, this is where Squad should tap some of the resources that Take Two has. Cause as we all know <crowd participation>Merchandizing is where the real money in the game is made</crowd participation>.

KSP the Image album, the Orchestral Bombing of "The O-4 March", the waltz styled "Fireball Slide", the slow meditative "Coasting the Void", the power rock of "Test Flight Alpha", the mournful "Contact Lost", the canon "MOAR BOOSTERS!", and many more.

...

Now available as a  two LP, two eight-track, or  two cassette tape set, from K-tel Records.

Edited January 28, 2019 by steuben

When I can be bothered to run Chrome in the background (it reduces performance a little bit, especially when my computer's in one of its moods), I like to listen to the Space Engine soundtrack:

(chilled ambient space music)

or Test Shot Starfish's Music for Space:

(cool-sounding electronic spacey music, used by SpaceX in their webcasts).

It depends on my mood. There are times it is strictly classical with compositions from Bach, Beethoven, Mozart, or even Gustav Holst. Then there are the days it's ACDC, Guns and Roses, Metallica, and Def Leppard. Then there's days like today where it's Bob Marley and Jimmy Buffett...

12 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

Bach

This

I (boringly) use stock music....

Not that I don't like music....I love it...yet every game I've ever played gets played with stock music....it's part of the game for me.....

Edited January 28, 2019 by maceemiller

41 minutes ago, maceemiller said:

I (boringly) use stock music....

Not that I don't like music....I love it...yet every game I've ever played gets played with stock music....it's part of the game for me.....

Yeah, KSP's stock music is really nice. The devs picked a good selection.

I recently got into Elite Dangerous and so discovered the excellent "Sidewinder Radio." A mix of relaxing and upbeat space themed music. (Plus a few "in universe" ads and messages but they are rare.)

https://www.radiosidewinder.com/listen-now/

Also, the Metroid Prime soundtrack obviously.

Recently read a post like this, except it was, could anyone compose music for KSP and improve the music already in there, to which I'm trying to do, good luck to me! But I must agree the music is a bit bland and I generally listen to Coldplay's A Sky Full of Stars on loop.
this during docking

No Time for Caution from the Interstellar soundtrack. I deliberately damaged an interplanetary craft and spun it up to high speeds when I had to Dock a Laythe SSTO to it. 

'You can't dock with the Kraken 7 Jeb!  It's impossible!' 

'No. It's necessary.'
MOSTLY GRUNGE, CLASSIC ROCK, AND PUNK. IT GETS YOU PUMPED UP AND ADRENALINED FOR YOUR 8 HOUR ION BURNS.

I usually play KSP by Hearing From the Earth to the Moon Soundtrack

Like all of em
Oh yeah, Final boss by Domyeah is a great song for building. Just something about that piano is so relaxing...
